references.paper_title: An image is worth 16x16 words: Transformers for image recognition at scale
references.reason: This paper introduced the Vision Transformer (ViT), a groundbreaking model architecture that uses transformers for image recognition, significantly impacting the field and serving as a foundational model in the current paper's method.
This foundational paper introduced Denoising Diffusion Probabilistic Models (DDPMs), a powerful generative model framework that underpins the core denoising methodology adopted in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Deep residual learning for image recognition
references.reason: The ResNet architecture, introduced in this paper, is a highly influential convolutional neural network (CNN) that forms the backbone for many image recognition models, including the one used in the present research.

This work introduced Mask R-CNN, a state-of-the-art object detection model which is used in the experimental evaluation of the current paper, demonstrating the effectiveness of the proposed method in various computer vision tasks.

This paper presented a large-scale person re-identification benchmark dataset (MSMT17), which serves as a crucial evaluation dataset used in the current paper's experimental results, demonstrating the effectiveness of the proposed method on a standard dataset for the task.
